summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to Swedish authorities for assistance in interviewing a witness in Sweden as part of the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's associates. The document outlines the investigation's focus on sexual misconduct with minors, confirms Epstein's death, and seeks permission for U.S. investigators to travel to Sweden for a voluntary witness interview scheduled for February 5, 2020.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: U.S. citizen alleged to have engaged in sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1995 to 2005, charged with sex trafficking of minors in July 2019, and committed suicide in August 2019 while awaiting trial.

events.title: Period of alleged sexual abuse by Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls during this approximate timeframe.

events.title: Epstein charged with sex trafficking
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with sex trafficking of minors in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein's suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while awaiting trial.

events.title: Scheduled witness interview in Sweden
events.description: A witness in Sweden has indicated willingness to be interviewed by U.S. authorities on this date.

keyFacts: The U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's network was ongoing as of January 2020, focusing on 'possible criminal actions by certain of Epstein's associates.'
U.S. authorities identified a witness in Sweden who allegedly observed 'certain of the victim's interactions with Epstein and his associates.'
The witness is described as a Swedish citizen residing in Stockholm, is not a target of the investigation, and had voluntarily agreed to be interviewed.
The document is a formal MLAT request under the 2001 U.S.-Sweden treaty, requesting confidentiality due to the sensitive nature of the investigation.
The investigative team seeking to travel to Sweden included Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, an FBI Special Agent, and an NYPD detective.
